snippet: Mick Deane, a cameraman for Sky News who was shot on Wednesday, was the first Western reporter to die on assignment in Egypt since the Committee to Protect Journalists started keeping such records in the 1990s.
abstract: Mick Deane, cameraman for Britain-based news network Sky News, is among hundreds of people killed in violence in Egypt; is the first Western reporter to die on assignment in Egypt since Committee to Protect Journalists started keeping such records in 1990s; other journalists describe close calls in the streets, and several were detained by local authorities.
lead_paragraph: Mick Deane, a cameraman for Sky News who was shot on Wednesday, was the first Western reporter to die on assignment in Egypt since the Committee to Protect Journalists started keeping such records in the 1990s.

headline.main: Cameraman for British Network Is Killed in Cairo

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
